excerpt: After the One Direction alum died at age 31, Liam Payne's friends and fans took to social media in tribute.
text: Following the unexpected death of Liam Payne, friends, fans and loved ones have taken to social media with an outpouring of emotional tributes. As reports broke that the One Direction alum died at age 31 on Wednesday when he fell from the balcony of his Buenos Aires, Argentina hotel room, Paris Hilton, Charlie Puth and more shared their memories of the musician online. “So upsetting to hear the news of @LiamPayne passing,” wrote Hilton on X. “Sending love and condolences to his family & loved ones. RIP my friend” Watch on Deadline Puth, co-writer of Liam’s 2017 single ‘Bedroom Floor’, shared a statement on his Instagram Story. “I am in shock right now. Liam was always so kind to me. He was one of the first major artists I got to work with. I cannot believe he is gone…” he wrote, also sharing a throwback photo with Payne. Zedd, who collaborated with Payne on the 2017 single ‘Get Low’, wrote on X, “RIP Liam… I can’t believe this is real… absolutely heartbreaking…” Dermot O’Leary, former The X Factor presenter, shared a throwback photo of himself and Payne on the show where One Direction got their start in 2010. “The worst news. I remember him as a 14 year old turning up to audition on The X Factor, and blowing us away singing Sinatra. He just loved to sing. He was always a joy, had time for everyone, polite, grateful, and was always humble. Sending love and prayers to his family. Dx,” wrote O’Leary on Instagram. Ty Dolla $ign shared a recent memory with Payne on his Instagram Story. “Just talked to you 2 days ago my guy. Ima miss u frfr sucio,” he wrote. html:
Following the unexpected death of Liam Payne, friends, fans and loved ones have taken to social media with an outpouring of emotional tributes.

As reports broke that the One Direction alum died at age 31 on Wednesday when he fell from the balcony of his Buenos Aires, Argentina hotel room, Paris Hilton, Charlie Puth and more shared their memories of the musician online.

“So upsetting to hear the news of @LiamPayne passing,” wrote Hilton on X. “Sending love and condolences to his family & loved ones. RIP my friend”

Watch on Deadline

Puth, co-writer of Liam’s 2017 single ‘Bedroom Floor’, shared a statement on his Instagram Story. “I am in shock right now. Liam was always so kind to me. He was one of the first major artists I got to work with. I cannot believe he is gone…” he wrote, also sharing a throwback photo with Payne.

Zedd, who collaborated with Payne on the 2017 single ‘Get Low’, wrote on X, “RIP Liam… I can’t believe this is real… absolutely heartbreaking…”

Dermot O’Leary, former The X Factor presenter, shared a throwback photo of himself and Payne on the show where One Direction got their start in 2010. “The worst news. I remember him as a 14 year old turning up to audition on The X Factor, and blowing us away singing Sinatra. He just loved to sing. He was always a joy, had time for everyone, polite, grateful, and was always humble. Sending love and prayers to his family. Dx,” wrote O’Leary on Instagram.

Ty Dolla $ign shared a recent memory with Payne on his Instagram Story. “Just talked to you 2 days ago my guy. Ima miss u frfr sucio,” he wrote.
